update.description:
Video: https://youtu.be/ZmdbzgP7f2Q

Adds a widget to the toolbar with options to move the camera to canonical angles - issue #1507.

If there's an object in the center of the screen, the camera moves keeping the object in the center, otherwise it moves about the world origin.

Also removed the hard coded default view angle, so now "reset camera" goes to the initial camera pose. You can test this with a world that starts with a different camera pose, such as `sphere_atlas_demo.world`.

The pull request was getting too large, so I'm leaving behind a couple of issues:

* On ortho view, the camera always moves to the same distance (zoom) - must look into ortho projection to see what's going on.

* The final pose might not be exactly aligned with the axes - must look into Camera::MoveToPosition to see what's going on.

![viewangles.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2208455905-viewangles.png)
update.title: Move the camera to canonical angles

content.html: Check out how it looks as of b1422e3. I changed the order of tests so the camera has to travel less between them and it fixed it for me. If it still fails for you I can increase the time as well.

content.html:
I think it's the wait time, changing it wait 1sec or more fixes the test for me

  // Process some events and draw the screen
  for (size_t i = 0; i < 100; ++i)
  {
    gazebo::common::Time::MSleep(10);
    QCoreApplication::processEvents();
    mainWindow->repaint();
  }

content.raw: Thanks. Our function naming style has never been consistent, and to date no one has complained. In general there are relatively few people who use Gazebo's API, and those few tend to be very savvy. The functions are well documented, and there are plenty of examples. There are also multiple avenues of help if someone gets confused. We won't have any problems here.
content.html: Thanks. Our function naming style has never been consistent, and to date no one has complained. In general there are relatively few people who use Gazebo's API, and those few tend to be very savvy. The functions are well documented, and there are plenty of examples. There are also multiple avenues of help if someone gets confused. We won't have any problems here.

content.raw: Argh, I'm not sure what's happening on `MoveToPosition`, but sometimes it doesn't move all the way to the desired pose, I think it might be related to the time. I'm not sure what's best here, to debug that function or to change the tests somehow. The tolerance of 1m is already huge :/
content.html: Argh, I'm not sure what's happening on MoveToPosition, but sometimes it doesn't move all the way to the desired pose, I think it might be related to the time. I'm not sure what's best here, to debug that function or to change the tests somehow. The tolerance of 1m is already huge :/
